title: DevFest Nantes 2018
speaker: Speaker Information
subscribe-note: No spam, only the latest news and updates!
tickets-details: Tickets grant access during 2 days to all conference sections, coffee breaks, lunch and party.
run-out-tickets: We have run out all our tickets
student-ticket-info: * Terms and Conditions üôâ
train-text:
Nantes is only a 2 hour Train ride away from Paris (TGV from Gare Montparnasse).
Once you are at the Nantes Railway station, take the Exit 'Gare Sud': the Cit√© des Congr√®s is only 10 minute walk away.
tram-text:
By tram, take the Line 1: Tram station 'Duchesse Anne - Ch√¢teau des Ducs de Bretagne', it is the Tram station after the TGV Train station (Exit: sortie Nord), heading into the City Centre. The venue La Cit√© des Congr√®s is only a 5 minute walk away from the tram station.

By the Busway, take the Line 4 of the Busway and alight at the 'Cit√© des Congr√®s' stop.
car-text:
La Cit√© des Congr√®s is in the City Centre of Nantes. We suggest to those planning on driving into Nantes, to park their cars at one of the ‚ÄòPark and Ride‚Äô (usually free parking) near a major Tram/ Busway station. You can then take Public Transport to get to the Venue. There are also Paid parking options available.
La Cit√© des Congr√®s proposes a Paid Parking that has 450 parking lots.
Here is a list of the Park and Ride stations: Interactive map or on the website of the Tan, the Nantes Public Transport company.
flight-text: The airport is at the periphery of the town. To go to the Cit√© des Congr√®s, you can use the Bus Service (20 minute ride), taxis or rent a car.
rocket-text: A Spaceport will be available on top of the Cit√© des Congr√®s to land. We will take care of your rocket during the festival.
hotel-text: The DevFest Nantes Organising Team has negotiated special price (exclusively for the event) with Residhome.
team-page-text:
The Google Developers Groups (GDGs) are groups of people interested in Google Platforms and Technologies: Android, Chrome, Google Apps, Angular, Cloud, AppEngine... These groups promoting sharing can be found all around the world.

The objective of GDG Nantes is to organise events regularly:

  • Google Technology Conferences and others on the Web, Cloud, Mobile.
  • Informal theme-based evening sessions around an Aperitif to facilitate meetings of similar minds and thoughts
  • Competitions (Hackathon, ...)
description: THE developer festival organized by developers! All about Mobile, IoT, Web and Cloud presented by experts from around the world for one of the largest technical conferences.
social-motto: Add to circles, like, follow or connect with us on
click-to-view-photos: Click here to view more photos
location-description: Located in the center of Nantes, the event takes place in the "Cit√© des Congr√®s" with more than 3000m¬≤ of conference rooms, hand's on and networking space...
hotel-description-residhome: The Serviced Apartments are located just across La Cit√© des Congr√®s. To avail of the special rates at The Residhome les Berges de la Loire, kindly use the Discounted rate code "DEVFEST 2018".
hotel-price-reservation-text-residhome:
Standard Studio Apartments: 91.00‚Ç¨ TTC per night in single, double or twin studio.
Buffet American Brakfast: 11.50‚Ç¨ per person per day.
Tourist tax: 2.25‚Ç¨ per person per day.
To make a reservation: caroline.dulong@reside-etudes.fr or call (+33)2 40 99 07 07.
about-organizers:
GDG Nantes is proud to organize the DevFest Nantes.
And a big thank you for our volunteers, students of Epitech Nantes
about-gdg: Google Developers Group (GDG) - is open and volunteer geek community who create exciting projects and share experience about Google technologies with a passion
faq-answer1: The DevFests are major community events throughout the world, following the tradition of Google Developer Days and organized by local user groups. They constitute a unique opportunity to share and network around the World of Web and cloud technologies! This event will be followed by an after-event party to discuss and network!
faq-answer2: The DevFest Nantes in 2018 is organized by GDG Nantes. More information on the Team page.
faq-question3: How to become a sponsor or partner?
faq-answer3: Simply by visiting our partnership proposition, or by contacting us by mail at organizers of GDG Nantes.
faq-question4: Where can I leave my luggage?
faq-answer4: Although the event is over several days, we do not allow participants to leave their luggage at the event. Cloakroom service is available free during the 2 days to deposit backpacks and jackets.
faq-answer5: All information relating to the arrival in DevFest is available on the Attending page.
faq-answer6:
The discounted rate is applicable only in the following categories:
  • Students
  • Teachers
  • In-between jobs
  • Unemployed
In all cases, access to the discounted rate will be available only on providing justification proof. Without justification proof, the participant can not to attend the event. No refund will be provided.
faq-question7: How will the DevFest be organised?
faq-answer7: This 2-days event will include three types of sessions: Conferences (50 minutes), Quickies events (20 minutes) and Codelabs (2 hours). Conferences and Quickies talks will be presentations by renowned speakers or Googlers evoking their favorite technologies. The Codelabs are more informal and will be an opportunity to put your hands (and feet) to work on code in the company of a technology expert in the field.
faq-answer8: This year you will find topics around the : Web, Mobile, IoT, Backend, Cloud, Big Data, Machine Learning, DevOps, Discovery ...
faq-question9: How to register and how much does it cost?
faq-answer9: Registration for DevFest Nantes can be done directly from this site by clicking the link on the home page. Admission is ‚Ç¨ 70 for the 2-day pass until June 30th 2018 then ‚Ç¨ 90 past this date, and ‚Ç¨ 20 for the discounted rate.
faq-question10: If I register and am not able to attend, can I get a refund?
faq-answer10: Our entire ticketing is handled by a service provider, so you can cancel your tickets under the conditions defined by this one. After the date of the event, no refund will be made.
faq-question11: I have registered but am unable to attend, can I give it to a friend?
faq-answer11: We can accept registration transfers. If you are aware of the change two weeks before the event, you can inform us so that we change the name on the attendee badge. If you are unable to inform us 2 weeks prior to the event (and are unable to make it), your "friend" must show up with your ticket and he/she will wear the badge registered in your name.
faq-answer12: All sessions except Codelabs will be recorded and made available on the Youtube channel GDG France
faq-question13: Are talks in English or French?
faq-answer13: The sessions can be both in English and in French, depending on the speakers chosen. As many speakers are from abroad, some sessions will be in English. These sessions will be indicated with a special icon.
faq-question14: How many presentations are held at the same time?
faq-answer14: There will be all day 5 parallel sessions (one session per subject and 1 codelab)
faq-answer15: The Registration will open on May 1st 2018 and will close on June 30th 2018 at 23:59
faq-question16: My presentation has been accepted, do I still need to buy an Entry ticket/ pass for the conference?
faq-answer16: Each speaker/ team of speakers is given a Free pass. It is therefore not necessary to buy a ticket. (Whether you are alone or several to present).
faq-question17: My presentation has not been accepted as yet, should I buy my Pass, just in case?
faq-answer17: We will contact all presenters and we will propose more presentation slots if necessary to faclitate registration.
faq-question18: When and Where is the event?
faq-answer18: The conference takes place on 18th and 19th October 2018 at the Cit√© des Congr√®s in Nantes.
faq-question19: I am organizing a User Group, how can I help you?
faq-answer19:
As a User Group, you can help us in several aspects:
  • By helping us find speakers
  • By broadcasting the event on your network. To facilitate this, we have several elements in the press section for distributing posters and banners at your disposal.
faq-answer20:
When participating in DevFest Nantes as a speaker or attendee, you agree to be recorded and photographed and potentially livestreamed.
You agree to use only royalty-free content or for which you have purchased the necessary licenses (images, music).
You agree that your presentation may be freely broadcast on Youtube.
faq-question21: As a speaker, am I free to use what I want?
faq-answer21: You agree to use only copyright-free content or for which you have made the necessary licenses purchases (images, music).
faq-answer22: Contact us by mail to the address bureau@gdgnantes.com.
text-speaker-arrival:
Depending on your travel, you may arrive the day before the event. We do not expect to run at you at the airport or at the train station. The hotel is closed to the train station in the city centre, so you can go there directly by walk or by cab (for your information, Uber is also available on Nantes).

You can also take your badge the day before at the Cit√© des Congr√®s between 12pm and 4pm.

If you want to go sightseeing, ask us for more information about the spots to visit. We like share and highlight the great spots of Nantes!
text-speaker-session:
During the DevFest day, we offer breakfast, lunch and after-party. Also, your hotel reservation do not include breakfast. If this bothers you, thank you for keeping us informed as soon as possible.

For the registration, we set a special desk for guests and speakers: thank you to present you there with your ticket. A coat check will be at your disposal and a speaker room will allow you to rest and communicate on social networks.

For your presentations, the types of connections for all rooms ar VGA and HDMI (please prefer the use of HDMI). If you think you will have a connection problem, thank you to inform us in advance so that we can fix the issue. Video projectors are designed to display presentations in 16/9 (except in Les Machines room).

About internet connections, a wifi access will be only available for speakers / sponsors (no ethernet connections except in Titan room). The connection codes will be sent to you by mail a few days before the event.

Your Talk will last 20mn maximum for quickies, 50mn for conferences and 1h50 for codelabs Questions / Answers included !
Thank you to respect this timing for the speaker after you.
text-speaker-slides:
This year we offer templates for your slides, you are free to use them or not. We will also set up a feedback form for participants, so feel free to ask participants to respond at the end of your presentation.

Could you also provide your slides in PDF format to add them to the event site.
text-speaker-hotel: For those who have requested a hotel room, everything is booked.
text-speaker-dinner: The day before the event we have reserved a restaurant, the Levrette Caf√©, for those available we suggest you meet at 19h (add to calendar).
schedule-text: The doors of the Cit√© des Congr√®s will open from 8am to 8pm on 18th October and from 8:30am to 7pm on 19th October.
accessibility-text:
GDG Nantes strives to make this event open and accessible to everyone, regardless of disability or special needs. Participants with disabilities and/or special needs should provide details in the registration form and/or by emailing us at bureau@gdgnantes.com. This information will be kept private and will be distributed only to the individuals who need to know it to accommodate your request. Otherwise, please approach one of the volunteer if you need assistance or have questions about accessibility during the event.

In La Cit√© des Congr√®s all areas are accessible for wheelchair users.
workshop-warning-header: Capacity for this workshop is limited.
workshop-warning-info: Session seats will be distributed on first-come, first-served basis.
